name: hiseq_precasava_sra
value: seqkit sample --threads 12 --rand-seed 123 -p 0.01 SRR3712208_1.fastq.gz | head -n 128 > real_fastqs/hiseq_precasava_sra_R1.fastq && seqkit sample --threads 12 --rand-seed 123 -p 0.01 SRR3712208_2.fastq.gz | head -n 128 > real_fastqs/hiseq_precasava_sra_R2.fastq

name: hiseq_precasava_sra
value: Downsample the original files to 1% using a set random seed to keep the same mate pairs in both forward and reverse read files, and keep the first 32 records (128 lines) in each file.

name: hiseq_precasava_multilane
value: head -n 64 hiseq_precasava_R1.fastq > hiseq_precasava_multilane_R1.fastq && tail -n 64 hiseq_precasava_R1.fastq | sed 's/:1:/:2:/' >> hiseq_precasava_multilane_R1.fastq; head -n 64 hiseq_precasava_R2.fastq > hiseq_precasava_multilane_R2.fastq && tail -n 64 hiseq_precasava_R2.fastq | sed 's/:1:/:2:/' >> hiseq_precasava_multilane_R2.fastq

name: hiseq_precasava_multilane
value: Modify the FASTQ record headers in the ‘original header-formatted’ FASTQ files so that the first 16 records will have a lane number of 1, and the remaining 16 records will have a lane number of 2.
